channel.title: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015
channel.description:
Very interesting report with data about independent software developers including mobile devs, webdevs, and desktop devs. (I guess that fits most of us here).
https://www.developereconomics.com/reports/developer-economics-state-of-the-developer-nation-q3-2015/
One caveat: to download the report you'll need to register on the site.
/edit: Here's an article summarising the report if you don't want to register: itworld.com/article/2957215/development/how-to-make-money-as-an-independent-developer.html
(Eh, sorry can't make the last link clickable - the forum tells me I'm not allowed to post links because I'm new ...)

item.title: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015
item.dc:creator: danielherken
item.description:
Can somebody explain how licensing is defined in this context?

Read full topic
item.source: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015

item.title: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015
item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
Licensing has become a significant part of my income…when licensing works, it is a really nice way of earning money from your software.

Read full topic
item.source: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015

item.title: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015
item.dc:creator: Andy
item.description:
Interestingly itworld.com/article/2957215/development/how-to-make-money-as-an-independent-developer.html shows:
-desktop developers make very nearly as much as cloud developers (revenue per developer?)
-licensing is more lucrative than ads

Read full topic
item.source: Developer Economics: State of the Developer Nation Q3 2015
